Name: 1852: Juego Histórico sobre la Batalla de Caseros
Description:
Historic wargame about the Argentinian Caseros battle.

Relive the deed of Urquiza or change history with the triumph of Rosas.


With the registered trademark 1852, a game of the same name came out in 1977 dedicated to remembering the Battle of Caseros, whose value undoubtedly derives from its rarity. It is, if not the first, at least one of the few board games that refer to a real historical event. It reproduced the conditions of the real battle on a board while the strategy was settled with dice and fifty-two plastic pieces.

— from the Dictionary of Argentine Toys, by Daniela Pellegrino
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Moustique attaque
Description:
Each player plays a mosquito and receives three cards: one sting card and two miss cards.

Four holidaymaker cards (divided into four different families) are placed in the center of the table.

The active mosquito must place its three cards face down on three holidaymakers and the next mosquito must place the swatter on one of the active mosquito's cards.

If the swatter is on the sting card, the turn ends and it is up to the next player to play, otherwise, that player places the victim of their bite on their hunting board.

Either they pass--and thus validate the points scored--or they replay.

If the swatter falls on the sting card, the turn ends and the active mosquito loses all cards from their hunting board. In this case, the player who handles the swatter wins a hunting token (which will score a point at the end of the game).

Players continue taking turns until one has collected four cards from a family or the draw pile (card or hunting token) is exhausted.

Points are tallied to determine the winner.

Name: ¡Pum... Gool!
Description:
¡Pum... Gool! is an old Argentinian football game, where two teams (players) will throw their dice alternatively (one with even numbers and the other with odd numbers) and move the ball in the grid between the different soccer player and field positions (goal, sides, end line).

The game is played to a agreed time in two halves. At the end of play time, the player with most goals wins.

—user summary

Name: Psychic Links
Description:
It might seem like it's all fun and games being psychically linked, but have you ever tried to hit a nice fairway drive while your opponent is moving the entire green with their mind?

Players first take turns to draw cards and place them building the course (until the hole card is placed). Each player starts with his token (ball) on a solid green square of the starting card.

Players will then take turns making shots (shown on the top of each card). To make a shot, choose any of the four face up options and move the ball as shown in the diagram. You may not choose the same option twice in a row. Sand and slope squares affect your shot. If the shoot includes an action, for example modifying the course, perform it as stated.

The first player to end a shot with the ball exactly in the hole wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Halloween Survivors Series II
Description:
A new group of survivors departs into the darkness to find out what awaits. Trick or treat! Packaged in a cheerfully illustrated box, this new hard plastic collection of costumed survivors includes 4 new thematic patterns and pattern gear cards.

The Halloween Survivors - Series II are packaged in an illustrated box that includes:
4 x Hard plastic survivors dressed in costumes inspired by their worst nightmares. Crimson Croc, White Lion, Screaming Antelope, and Gorm survivors.
4 x Large Matte art print of the Series II Halloween survivors.
4 x Pattern cards
4 x Pattern gear cards

Name: Juego de Policía y Ladrón
Description:
1940's Argentinian game.

In Police and Thief you have your thief character and you move him to the banks / post office to rob. Then you must return to your lair before you are captured by the player who is driving the policemen.

Name: 30秒でナンパしな！ (30byou de nanpa shina!)
Description:
30ç§’ã§ãƒŠãƒ³ãƒ‘ã—ãªï¼ (30byou de nanpa shina!) is an adult themed part game from Japan. Players must use three words from the deck as part of an instant pick-up line. Come up with the best line to win each round.
user summary

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – White Sunlion Armor & White Sunlion Mask
Description: A lightweight version of White Lion Armor, usable in People of the Sun Campaigns. This set will grant the user more movement, less armor and the ability to ignore the extreme heat that would otherwise make wearing the heavy White Lion furs impossible under the intense rays of the sun sleeping in the sky.

Name: One Night Queen
Description:
One Night Queen is an adult-themed card game from Japan. Players are women looking to pick up attractive men on the bar scene. They bid to get the best dates using their 'pride'. Players failing to get their man lose pride, and the date goes to the woman playing the best role.

The deck features a variety of men rated 1-5 hearts or a diamond, each with text in Japanese. The publisher says it is "anomalous poker betting with lady's pride".
user summary

Name: Flota Mercante
Description:
1940's Argentinian game.

Each player must navigate from Buenos Aires to Las Palmas, choosing the route: Orient to India, or Occident to England and North America, going back by the Pacific.

Each turn, players will throw the dice and advance as many squares as dice points. When a port is reached, a Knowledge card is drawn with some effects (earn money). When a red spot is reached, an Event card is drawn, and its effects take place. Black spots mark the entry to a port, and to reach them a exact roll is required.

When all players return to Buenos Aires, money is awarded according to the arrival order, and the player with most money wins.

—user summary

Name: Farándula
Description: Old Argentinian game.

Name: やーいすけべ (Yaisukebe)
Description:
ã‚„ãƒ¼ã„ã™ã‘ã¹ (Yaisukebe) is an adult-themed party card game from Japan. Players are lads at school. Somebody has brought dirty magazines to school, and tries to hid them in someone else's schoolbag. There's a bag inspection! Nobody wants to be caught with it, and players try to empty their hand while passing it on.

Alternately, if a player can collect all the porn, they win.
user summary

Name: Guess猥談 (Guess Dirty Talk)
Description:
GuessçŒ¥è«‡ (Guess Waidan) (Guess Dirty Talk) is an adult-themed party game from Japan. Players recount true tales or fantasies based upon the themes on the cards. Points are scored if the listeners can guess the theme based on the tale, and for telling the best stories. The game is intended to be played while drinking, to swap dirty stories for amusement.
user summary

Name: Present Pile-Up
Description:
It's time to pack the sleigh and Santa needs your help! In this fast-paced game, aim, toss and launch presents into the sleigh, then race around the board to win the game. Are you ready for the Present Pile-Up challenge? Roll the die. Launch the presents. Who will be Santa's best help?

On each players turn they roll the die to see how far they move along the board and then follow the instructions on the space where they landed. Many spaces give players a chance to use the included catapult to try and launch a present into the sleigh. Once all of a player's presents are in the sleigh they can then move across the Golden Bridge to jump in the sleigh themselves, but roll carefully! You have to roll the exact number to make it to the sleigh!

Name: Have at You!
Description:
Have at You! is a quick-playing card game about hand-to-hand combat during the 16th to 18th Centuries, as inspired by films such as the Errol Flynn classics of the 1940s as well as the more recent Pirates of the Carribean series. Each player takes the role of fighters who can get their hands on any weapons available to defeat the enemy. Each fighter has a fixed number of physical damage points that, once expended, result in his or her death.

In the base set, combat takes place aboard a ship, with the kind of weaponry available that one might expect: Daggers, Cutlasses, Belaying Pins, Pikes, Pistols, Grappling Hooks, and the occasional Bottle of Rum. Future expansions will explore other locations, such as Taverns and Encampments.

Play follows a basic rock-paper-scissors mechanic of taking actions when available and trying to avoid their cancellation through the opponent's play of reaction cards. But be careful! Every action causes fatigue, with nastier weapons causing more of it. As fighters get tired, fatigue turns to physical damage, so a player must balance the health of their own fighter while trying to take down the enemy.

There are several ways to play the game. At the most basic is a "duel" where a player wins once his or her opponent goes down. "Brawls" can also be played, where the death of an opponent "spawns" a new enemy, so victory is dependent upon the number of fighters eliminated on both sides. This base set also supports up to four players, so teams can fight against each other, while assisting teammates.

The base set includes over 140 "mini-cards" that can be self-printed along with the other tracks necessary to play. There is also an option to have the mini-cards professionally published at a reasonable cost. All of the components were designed to fit within a "video tape box."

NOTE: The "Card(s)" option does not include the rules and charts needed for play. If you want the cards and the rest of the game, make sure to select the PDF+Card(s) option.

Come test your mettle on the high seas with Have at You!

-description from designer

Name: Bear Stare Down: Scout Expansion
Description:
Adds 20 new bear, action, forest, and diffuse cards as well as adding two more players to Bear Stare Down base game and upgraded forest cards.

Also adds:

3 KS exclusive cards:  
Care Bear - This tender hearted bear adds a life back
Share Bears - both  you and your opponent lose a life 
Dare Bear - Do a Dare and save your life

20 scouting theme cards: Handy Pocket Knife, Smores, First Aid Kit, Bear Bag, Compass, Legendary Scare Bear, etc.

Name: Infernal Machine: Dawn of Submarine Warfare
Description:
The time: late evening
The date: 17 February 1864
The Place: Breach Inlet, South Carolina

Standing in the submarine’s forward hatch, Lieutenant George E. Dixon pulled his cap down and tightened up his oilskin watch coat. The February sea cut through to his bones. This was the third night he ventured from behind Battery Marshall on Sullivan’s Island, and his seven-man crew was grumpy from having had no luck spotting, let alone attacking even one of the Yankee warships blockading Charleston harbor.

Dixon fingered the dented $20 gold piece in his trouser pocket. It was a gift from Queenie, his sweetheart, a keepsake that already earned its place aboard ship. A few months earlier at a wooded tangle of a place called Shiloh, the coin stopped a minie ball from shattering his leg. The dent reminded him how fickle fate and fortune are in this war, and it reminded him of home. He had that coin engraved “Shiloh April 6th, 1862. My life Preserver” and added his initials “G.E.D.”, so sure was he of the coin’s power.
Well, tonight that power was napping. Frustrated and cold, Dixon took one last look to the southeast through his telescope. The weather wasn’t likely to improve and he hoped that this would be the night he and the crew of the “CSS Hunley” would strike a blow against the Yankee blockade.

Here now… was that a light?
There!
And once again, low and to the south-southeast. A light!

He rapped the coin against the hull to startle the men. “Look sharp,” he muttered. Then, in a voice low and tense, he said “Look sharp and prepare to crank!”

Game Overview

Infernal Machine: Dawn of Submarine Warfare is a solitaire board game that casts the player in the role of inventor/entrepreneur in mid-19th century America. The game is set during a historical moment when the business environment has gotten rather dynamic – it is the tumultuous landscape of the American Civil War. The player’s task is to design, build, and put to use a submarine during that war.

Infernal Machine can be played either in scenario form or campaign. In a campaign, you can choose the city or port where the project’s machine shop will be located. Since construction materials and labor costs money, your role as entrepreneur comes into play as you seek out Investors to join your team; their cash will provide the funds that help your Fishboat take shape. As Inventor, your design gives form and substance to the size and shape of your submarine, and to its capabilities. Will it carry a snorkel? Will its prow be an armored ram? Will it have dive planes? Will it push a spar torpedo? Will it be powered by the muscle strength of a crew cranking the propeller or will you install a boiler engine?

To bring blueprints to life, you will need to hire Mechanics, whose engineering expertise keeps the machine’s construction on schedule. Once assembly is complete, your Mechanics can join the crew, using their repair capability to keep the machinery and the vessel running smoothly. Journeymen can also lend a hand on the shop floor and inside the Fishboat, while Sailors bring nautical know-how as well as sheer brawn.

While that machine shop is busy with the submarine’s construction, the game reminds you that the war drags on and it is an unstable business environment. Prices for materials and labor fluctuate. Current events can affect your construction schedule and your machine shop’s performance. Public, and even personal circumstances may force your hand. You may decide to push your Fishboat into the water before you feel it is optimal, or push your crew into battle with little training.

In this game you assign crew, taking their characteristics into consideration, such as morale, strength, engineering expertise. Your first mission will most likely be a simple affair, propelling the infernal machine forward, submerging, turning about, and returning to the surface. It will garner valuable experience that improves your crew’s Training Level. But even that simple affair could prove treacherous. Will the Fishboat drift? Will it sink and become irretrievable? Will your crew panic in the dark as they breathe in the exhalation of their comrades in that cramped machine? Will you be forced to evacuate the crew and salvage the Fishboat later? Will the crew survive the ordeal?

Later missions will be directed at the enemy. In this game, you may play either side, Union or Confederate. There are a variety of missions and targets. Will your Fishboat be aimed at the Federal blockade? Will it pull a mine at the end of a rope, or push a torpedo at the end of a spar? Will the crew survive contact with the enemy? Will they survive their own weapon’s detonation? Perhaps the nature of the mission will be quite different. Will you carry a spy into enemy territory? Will your Fishboat unload a raiding party?

Secrecy is vital. Will you send your machine out under a moonless sky? That will help conceal crew and machine but it will make navigation difficult. Will you limit the number of machinists and investors, thereby reducing the chance of rumor or gossip leaking out? Too few and you compromise your machine’s capabilities. Your Fishboat’s chances are much better if that machine is kept a secret, but it is a cantankerous machine that will punish mistakes.

A successful mission means your coffers will be filled with prize money. This is a capitalist’s war, and the War Department is offering juicy bounties. In contrast, there are many ways to fail. Coming back without making contact with the enemy is one way, but it could be far worse. Will you add the names of your crew to the Rolls of the Missing?

Scenarios and Campaign

Historical scenarios use only part of the rules to present such events as the CSS Hunley’s successful attack outside Charleston Harbor in 1864. It was the first time a submarine sank its target, a landmark event in military history. The heart of the game is the campaign, which allows you to design and build your Infernal Machine, select a crew, train that crew, and perform missions against the enemy. You manage funds and personnel, and navigate the fortunes of war as well as the waterways in enemy territory. A scenario will take approximately two hours to play while a campaign can last several gaming sessions as it spans the calendar from 1861 to the end of the war in 1865.

Sequence of Play

Each monthly turn gives you an opportunity to recruit personnel (Investors, Mechanics, Journeymen, or Sailors), each represented by a deck of cards. Each recruit comes with one or more benefits as well as costs or drawbacks. An Investor, for example, may be a generous provider of funds, but he may insist on being the captain of the ship. Does he know what he’s doing?! A Sailor may prove to be strong and cool under pressure, but he may be clumsy. Will that clumsiness jeopardize his crewmates?

Each turn also provides you an opportunity to work on your Fishboat. You purchase Bulkheads and other major sections of the submarine, each represented by tiles. They cost funds and require engineering expertise to incorporate into a seaworthy vessel. You also purchase a variety of mechanisms as you make decisions about the capability of your Fishboat.

Recruitment and Building is followed by the passage of time when the Month marker is moved forward on the calendar. Debts must be paid, if you have any, and you must check the Fortunes of War table to see if something unexpected happens that month. Will prices rise? Will one of your Journeymen get engaged and leave your shop? Will the enemy shell the wharf where your Fishboat is waiting to go into action? Will you get an offer to use your machine shop to make parts for the War Department, giving you a contract and additional funds? Will the enemy capture the town, forcing you to move to another location? Each month has its own table of random events, and there is one set used when playing Union and another when playing Confederate. This adds to the feel of the historical experience while also increasing replayability. The Confederate experience is quite different from playing the Union. The latter is an industrial business environment while the Confederacy’s economy gradually spirals into oblivion.

Each month you have the option to finish the turn by taking your seaworthy Fishboat into action. There are four Action Boards in the box, each providing its own unique historical and nautical conditions (Charleston, Mobile, New Orleans, and the James River from City Point to Richmond).

You setup a mission by establishing meteorological conditions on the Action Board (drift direction, drift intensity, visibility, and weather), and assign each crewman a position inside your Fishboat. Will you call off the mission because the current is too strong? Will you wait for a better opportunity, or will you push ahead despite the risk?

Your submarine will move from one space to the next as it executes its mission. During a mission you assign jobs to each crewman (crank, repair, rally, or operating a mechanism). This is new technology and the submarine is an untried machine, so malfunctions are likely and you will assign crew to manage and hopefully repair them. In many cases, just getting out there and locating a target is a victory of sorts, and getting the crew back home can feel like a triumph. Of course, your mandate is to do more than make contact with the enemy and survive. To gain prize money, you will have to prove your machine’s efficacy against the enemy. It’s an old story: higher the risk, greater the reward.

If you manage to navigate your machine and crew to make contact with its target, action shifts to the Tactical Board. There, the Fishboat closes in and you hope conditions are right so that it remains concealed. Decisions you made leading up to this tense moment have put your crew in a good position, or maybe in a bad one. In either case, history is watching.

Game Components
4 Actions Boards (12” x 18”),
1 Mechanics Board (8” x 18”),
1 Tactical Board (8.5” x 11”),
3 Countersheets (including boat tiles),
3 Card Decks (Recruits, Navigation, Discovery),
2 d10 dice
Booklets and Player Aids

-description from publisher's website

Name: Mask Village Poker
Description:
You are the Mayor of your village. You want it to grow and attract more villagers. Fortunately, there are many applicants to join the village. That’s fine!
But, as well as people, there are animals, and supernatural creatures and all sorts applying. Foxes, Spirits, Werewolves, oh lots of strangeness!
No problem! Do your best to expand your village.

The players draw one card, and choose one of the follows.
1. You take it for the scoring.
2. You pass it to the left player.

In the round, the players plays until 3 card for you, 3 card for the left player.

Then, it's the next phase "Action phase".
Some cards have the ability for action with the number.
The number is called, and the player with the card play the action.

After all action cards are played, scoring.
The players total the cards in the front.

In the first and second round, the players take the point cards along the scoring.
In the third round, the players total the scoring and the point cards.

The highest player is the winner.

Name: Conteur de pipes
Description:
Conteur de pipes is a game where you need to tell a story that is true or completely false depending on what you get. The others players need to know if you are bluffing or not to gain points.

—user summary

Name: Fais-moi un dessin 2
Description:
2 teams face each other and the goal is to make your partner guess what you are drawing before the timer runs out.

The team that guesses the most drawings wins.

Based on the French tv show.

Name: Lasalle (Second Edition)
Description:
Lasalle is a tactical Napoleonics game suitable for beginners or veterans in which any army can fight any other or you can play historical scenarios. Players are a division or corps commander leading battalions of infantry, batteries of artillery and regiments of cavalry. A game is an affair for about three hours’ play on a modest table with about a dozen units on each side with no paperwork other than marking disruption against a unit's track.

The second edition has a new sequence of play, driven by momentum and interrupts, allows players to do virtually anything in any order, differently every turn. Completely new rules for the use of the general figure (i.e. “you”) permit you to choose the personality and effect of your intervention in the sequence. Skirmishing has been reinvented from the top-down. The two sides contribute skirmishers to their opposing “screens” and each turn they determine which side’s screen has the advantage. That, in turn, affects the momentum and sequence, not to mention possibly preventing worn units from rallying, obscuring targets from shooters, or even sniping at infantry units as they try to change formations. Movement has been radically simplified. Rather than worrying about evolutions of individual units, movement gets you from point A to B with a certain number of “complications” that accrue as you try to do difficult things like changing formation near the enemy, moving through difficult terrain, interpenetrating, or attacking. Combat has been redesigned so that it is a more decisive either/or experience. Troops either press an attack home, or they are discouraged and fall back with few casualties to either side.

Second Edition Lasalle is a much more holistic game where you are playing not just individual units but rather an entire military effort, and everything affects everything else. You control the sequence and pace of events while your opponent tries to wrest that control from you. What your soldiers can accomplish is not just the result of moving them and rolling dice, but part of the overall situation into which you’ve led your army.

Name: Harry Potter: Memory Master
Description:
A CARD GAME FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY: Put your memory to the ultimate test with your fellow witches and wizards at your next magical party and game night with this incredibly entertaining Harry Potter card game that the whole family can enjoy.

—description from the publisher

In this game, players are split in pairs. Each round, each player receives five cards. They get a moment to study their cards, and then exchange them with their partners. Then, each player plays one card facedown (with the intention to pick one that matches the one their partner will play). The played cards are then turned face-up. A team scores two points if both the color and the character on their cards match, and one point if either the color or the character matches. The first team to reach twelve points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Gamestormers
Description:
Gamestormers is a creative, tableau-building card game for 3-6 players. In the game, you are a young, up-and-coming gamestormer in the futuristic land of Fjerogard who must impress the Elder Gamestormer with a great new game idea. The object of the game is to design and pitch a great game idea to the rest of the players.

During the game, players fill out their game tableaus using a variety of actions, such as taking Item cards from the market, drafting Storyline and Mechanic cards, designing custom cards using dice with images, or entering the Arena. All of the actions allow the player to acquire new cards for the game they are designing or earn victory points.

There are two ways to win the game - either create a game that is worth the most victory points, or receive the most votes for best overall game from your fellow players. The game you create consists of a Storyline card, two Mechanic cards, and two Items cards, each of which you will use to create a cohesive game narrative. Each card in your game tableau earns you points, as well as other bonuses you can activate by reaching certain objectives.

-description from designer

Name: Rising Sun: The First Sino-Japanese War, 1894-1895
Description:
"Rising Sun: The First Sino-Japanese War, 1894-1895" is a historical board wargame that deals with the entire First Sino-Japanese War, which was the first foreign war for modern Japan. Players take charge of Japan or the Qing Dynasty and fight for control of the Korean Peninsula, Liaodong Peninsula, Shandong Peninsula, and Penghu Islands. Alternatively, the Japanese Army can challenge the Zhili decisive battle.

As with historical facts, the Navy has a big role to play in games. At that time, the infrastructure was not well-developed, and it was the transport vessels that could most efficiently carry large numbers of troops and supplies, and command of the sea was needed to secure maritime transport. How will the Combined Fleet challenge the Beiyang Fleet, which has the battleships Dingyuan and Zhenyuan, which were called the strongest ships in the Orient? And how will the Japanese Army capture the fortress of Lushun and Weihaiwei?

The game system of this game is called card-driven, and makes full use of cards that represent war resources and historical events and tactics. But more important than how to use the card is a "strategy" that looks at how to end the war.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Simplicity in Practice: Horse and musket rules
Description: Simplicity in Practice is a set of miniature wargame rules for the Horse-and-Musket period published in the wargaming magazine Battlegames (Issue 23).  It is designed for playing 'tabletop teaser' scenarios of the kind written by Charles Grant, Stuart Asquith, Henry Hyde and Steve Jones amongst others, with a small number of figures on a small board (typically 3'x2').  It aims to use very simple mechanisms to aid understanding and speed of play.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Three Norman Battles
Description: A set of miniature wargames rules published in Wargames Illustrated 31 for refighting battles from the 'Anarchy' civil war period of English history, where forces loyal to the King and Empress fought each other for control of England.

Name: Things... Schitt's Creek: Bébé Game
Description:
Everyone’s favorite game meets everyone’s favorite show! In this hilarious game, you read a topic card and then write down your response. It can be anything that comes to mind—there’s no right or wrong answer! Then all the responses are read aloud, and you have to figure out who said what! You won’t believe the THINGS… the people you know will come up with! With the Schitt’s Creek Edition, explore your thoughts about the show and it’s hilarious characters and see what THINGS… you’ll say!

Note: This is a smaller version of Things... Schitt's Creek which contains only 70 cards, compared to 188 cards and additional components found in the later version.

Name: Guédelon: Le Moulin
Description: This is a mini-expansion that came with the Kickstarter version but is also available for download from Asychron games. The mill is an additional building that increases the difficulty and extends the visitors' tour of the premises.

Name: Spuntino in Sardegna
Description:
If you too have eaten Casu marzu, if you always carry the Island in your heart, you have chosen the perfect game.
Spuntino is quick and easy, perfect for an evening with friends or family, ideal for adults and children who love good regional cuisine.

With Spuntino's illustrated cards, you can indulge yourself in inventing new culinary combinations and combine a thousand flavors to get more points than your opponents.
Are you ready for an explosion of Sardinian tastes?
Each game lasts about 30 minutes, just like a real snack, and then you'll be ready for a new game where you can enjoy new delightful flavors.
You will have 110 illustrated playing cards at your disposal to create the most combinations and declare a snack. You can also create delicious combinations with wine and "filu'e ferru" and become the sommelier of the family.

The aim of this board game is to get the highest number of points by making combinations of typical Sardinian dishes. To win, you will have to become the Snack King by getting more points than your opponents.

Name: Paddy McGinty's Goat
Description:
Paddy McGinty's Goat is an Australian game based on a 1917 war-time comic song of the same name. Performed by the American duo The Two Bobs (Bob Alden and Bob Adams). It tells the story of an aggressive goat that enters the village of Killaloe in Ireland. The original score also has the goat defeating the German army and the Kaiser

A simple roll and move game where players use a small wooden marble to move along a path by the roll of he dice. The playing board is slightly elevated at one end to create a slope. The path mostly contains a series small holes for the marble to sit, but every so often on the path is a much larger hole where if a player lands directly on the large hole by the dice roll then the wooden marble falls through and rolls down the slope to the start and the player must begin again.

A player may "Butt" an opponent forward if he directly lands on that player. First player to reach Paddy McGinty's Goat's right eye is deemed the winner.

Name: Podaj Łapę
Description:
This time it is you give a paw to your four-legged friends!

The players volunteer for the shelter and help find suitable dog houses.
The participant of the game must plan and execute a training plan for his pupils in order to improve their skills and strengthen their qualities. Each of the owners who want to adopt a pet expects different characteristics. Some are looking for a companionable and patient dog, others - courageous and strong.
Pass the paw and become a friend of the animals!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Find Your Way Out
Description:
Are you ready to lift the secret of the library?

With horror you discover that you're trapped inside the dark Monestary library. Your only chance to escape are 30 riddles you discover hidden in a Bible...

A bible themed escape game for home..

Name: Fog of Love: Valentine's Day 2020 promo
Description:
Promotional card for Valentine's Day 2020.

You suggest a quiet night at home.

Promo 17

Name: Darkridge Reunion
Description:
It’s Jocks vs. Geeks vs. Rebels in this live action game that’s part murder mystery, part survival game and entirely devious.

Darkridge Reunion is a dynamic whodunnit party game played over three rounds. Each player is given a role (jock, geek, or rebel) and are attending a high school reunion.

Players will use social deduction and clues to find who is on which team but more importantly who is the slasher.

Each player is given a secret mission and an artifact.

Name: Schalten: Aber Schlau – Das Große Energieeffizienzspiel
Description:
Schalten - Aber Schlau: Das Große Energieeffizienzspiel is a trivia game about energy usage put out by a German energy supplier to help folks learn about their energy efficiency.

—user summary

Name: The Final Light-Year: The Jade Sector
Description:
November 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds the new sector map, a spaceport, commander and minion ships and a new market card.


Released in the November 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: The Final Light-Year: The Krog Sector
Description:
December 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, commander and minion ships, and new crew.


Released in the December 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Full House: Mini-expansion fans/e-mail (Limited edition)
Description:
20 new guests inspired by fans of Château Lafortune
20 new emails inspired by ideas from Château Lafortune fans. Emails that add some strategy!

Definitely the extension of the audience and the perfect complement to your game!

20 nouveaux invités inspiré de fans du Château Lafortune
20 nouveaux courriels inspiré des idées des fans de Château Lafortune.  Des courriels qui ajoute quelques stratégie!

Définitivement l'extension du public et le complément parfait de votre jeu!

Name: Bacci Pagano: il gioco
Description:
The game is inspired by Bruno Morchio's novels starring Bacci Pagano, an ironic and disillusioned Genoese private investigator.

You will have to work together to help the famous Genoese private investigator Bacci Pagano to solve five cases. Five unpublished stories set between Genoa and Sardinia, a map of the city and a newspaper page full of clues: this is the material contained in the box that, together with a good dose of investigative intuition and a spirit of adventure, will guide you in the investigation.

The game contains five stories:


     Book thieves
     The suspect ship
     Transfer to Ogliastra
     In the age of Coronavirus
     Invisible lives

Name: Hunt A Killer: Agatha Christie's The Mystery of Hunter's Lodge
Description:
Wealthy magnate Harrington Pace has been murdered. Captain Arthur Hastings would typically employ the expertise of renowned detective Hercule Poirot, but the legendary sleuth has come down with a bout of influenza. Hastings turns to the world’s second greatest detective to help solve the case: you. Tackle the case one clue at a time by solving puzzles, diving into the evidence, and eliminating the suspects one by one.

CHALLENGE YOURSELF
‍‍
Work with Arthur Hastings to sort through the evidence and find clues to catch the murderer.
Be the main character and solve an Agatha Christie case in this murder mystery game.

Difficulty: 3/5 - Medium

Name: Maglev Metro: London & Paris
Description:
Maglev Metro: London & Paris features two new expansion maps for Maglev Metro:

In London, one of the world's oldest subway system is finally getting a much needed upgrade thanks to magnetic levitation technology! In order to reinvigorate London's transportation system, all stations are unlocked; pick up any passenger even on your first turn!


     Players start with extra passengers to activate more areas on their player board.
     London is divided into districts, and you'll need access to build track to various parts of the city.
     The new Unlock Districts extension modifies your player board so instead of unlocking passenger colors, players unlock districts.


And then there's Paris, well known for its mass transit strikes and your new Maglev Metro enterprise there is no exception. There are strikes scheduled constantly throughout the city at various stations!


     Union bosses strike at a different station every few turns, shutting down all business at affected stations: trains zip right on past the stations and passengers cannot be picked up or dropped off until they reopen.
     They're so brazen they've published a strike schedule! At least this helps you plan ahead of time.
     Defy the picket lines as a strike breaker, which costs you VPs in order to save you time.


—description from the publisher

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Holiday Pack
Description:
A set of 20 holiday-themed cards.

The preview photo of the expansion shows the cards:
- Christmas celebration
- Lunar calendar
- Trick or treating

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: KS Promos 4
Description:
A set of the 119 cards that were unlocked as Stretch Goals in the 2020 "Big Box and Nostalgia Expansion" Kickstarter-Campaign.

Through the KS4 Promo pack, you will be introduced to new modules like the category Friends and School, which contains it’s own sub-category, Athletic & Performing Arts Career Jobs, while also adding new cards to our already existing packs! In addition to the generous deck of playing cards you will also receive a Friends board addition and a School board addition. So be sure you gift yourself the pleasure to experience our game at it’s fullest!

This mini expansion contains new cards which introduce new modules, as well as cards that add to the already existing Item/Activities, Projects, Community, Jobs and Experiences packs.

Name: Sushi Scramble
Description:
GRAB THE SUSHI! In this fun children's game, players use chopsticks to grab pieces of sushi that match the menu card before the chef knocks them off the belt. Get them all before the chef gives you the CHOP!

—description from the publisher

Name: 一瞬の名画、あるいは無意識の目覚め (A momentary masterpiece or an unconscious awakening)
Description:
ä¸€çž¬ã®åç”»ã€ã‚ã‚‹ã„ã¯ç„¡æ„è­˜ã®ç›®è¦šã‚ (A momentary masterpiece or an unconscious awakening) is a drawing and deduction game from Japan. Players take on the roles of artists and critics, and create artworks to be assessed by the other players.

The game has a deck of cards with themes and other with interpretations. A player creates a drawing and displays it in a picture frame. The other players critique the work according to the choices on the cards (ABC, 123) and vote with markers on the rondel. Does the artwork represent A1 or C2 and so on. Then the artist reveals the intent they had written down.

Players then advance their meeples on the rondel depending on how well they did compared to the expectation.

The game be played with young children by using simple themes and motifs. The intent is to create a happy interaction between artists.
user summary

Name: Puff Ball
Description:
PUFF, RACE, WIN. In Puff Ball, players will have to take the ball from cup to cup and through a series of obstacles to the end of the track. But there's a twist - you can only do so by puffing the ball.

—description from the publisher

Name: Conflict of Dreams
Description:
Players build a deck of cards and duel against their opponent's deck. Players are champions attempting to reduce their opponent's life total to zero. The first player to reduce the opponent's champion to zero or otherwise destroy the opponent's champion card is the winner..

First off, the game has a deck construction element to it, which is done before to the actual game by choosing what cards are included in a deck. This must include 1 champion card, no more, no less and 50 other cards of the players choice, although a player cannot have more than 3 copies of any card.

The game has four major factions, all of which use champion, cast and reaction cards, besides that each faction has their own special types of cards they can use: 
The Meritus uses equipment cards (such as swords and shields) and equipping these cards allows their champion to use them as an extension of his/herself.
The Sortis has enchantments which have over time effects and they also have spell cast cards.
The Divitiae have construct and upgrade cards so they can build machines and improve them.
Diogeni have creature, plant and force of nature cards to gain bonus resources and grow stronger over the course of the game.

Players gain resources and draw cards from their deck to determine what they can play each turn. Many cards have bonus conditions or options which allow for advanced strategies. There is a good list of game mechanics, including a mechanic called "the conflict" which lets players respond to each others action and allows more skilled players the opportunity to pull ahead while remaining easy enough for new players to learn.

Though the game is intended for a two-player duel, there is room to allow more players to play.

—description from the designer

Name: El Bucanero
Description:
Letters are placed in the center of the table. All the silver coins are distributed in equal parts.

The gold coins are in the power of a single player (who will be called the payer) who will then distribute 5 cards to each player.

These should be face down.

After a signal each one turns over their first card.

The player who first made all the words that indicate his 5 cards gives the signal to stop.

Each player must pay the participant who completed all the words first, a silver coin for each card that he did not complete.

If the player who stops the game does not have all 5 words complete or there are spelling errors, he pays a fine of 2 silver coins to each of the players. When the collection is settled, the cards are redistributed, leaving aside those used in the previous round.

It is played over 5 rounds and the winner is the one who accumulates the most points at the end.


Originally release in 1940's by Casa Estanciero.

It is one of the best board games created in Argentina, and for 6 decades it has been entertaining young and old alike. It is quick to play, since with the large number of letters there are, you will have to put together the words that correspond to the definitions of the cards. In this way, you can win the treasure of gold and silver coins.

Name: 世界恐蝗 (The World's Fear of Locusts)
Description:
ä¸–ç•Œæè— (The World's Fear of Locusts) is a co-operative game from Japan for three players only. Players are working to stop locust swarms across the world by researching grasshoppers, and by attack swarms of locusts spreading on the wind.

Each player takes on a role in the game, entomologist (Studying insects), a control expect, and a supply expert. The players win by completing their research and eliminating the locust swarms. Even under harsh conditions, players can work out a successful solution.

The game board shows various sections of land, and a spinner decides the wind direction, controlling how the locusts spread. The game includes 3D grasshoppers and locusts.
user summary

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Vehicle Guide
Description:
In this 70 page book are suggested vehicle builds for the 32 miniatures released in the Car Wars Sixth Edition four player core game and four miniature set expansions.  There are 32 builds for smaller games, and 32 more for larger games, making a total of 64 unique designs that utilize game cards from the sets listed below:


     Core Set
     Miniatures Set 1
     Miniatures Set 2
     Miniatures Set 3
     Miniatures Set 4
     Armory Pack
     Linked Weapons Pack
     Crew Pack
     Dropped Weapons Pack
     Uncle Al's Upgrade Pack


Also included are two scenarios that provide custom arena setups and unique, scenario-specific rules to add even more variety, strategy, and chaos to your duels.

Name: Bought Red Handed
Description:
The outrageous story-telling game where you battle to put together the world's most unfortunate shopping cart.

Forget window-shopping, it's time to splash the cash and hit "checkout" in this messed-up game of materialism!  Filled with 400 item cards - anything from duct tape to 1,500 live lady bugs - players battle it out to submit the funniest combination of items for the purchasing scenario listed on the situation and trap cards.

Will you have to buy a wedding present for your ex-partner for under $20? Or pick up supplies for a romantic getaway within a short time limit?

Once you've selected your items, get ready to weave a funny story to explain your choices and win the round!

Name: Mittelmäßig
Description:
A 2 player Jass with a traditional deck. Each player plays against the other player and also a single shared “dummy” who is considered a player in its own right but whose cards are played by both. The goal is to capture tricks so that one’s total captured card-points are either the highest or the lowest of the two humans and dummy--that is, avoiding being in the middle.  After each hand the top and bottom slots earn sticks (positive game points) while the middle slot earns potatoes (negative game pts). As both players compete against each other over eight hands to earn the most sticks, the Winner must also ensure the Dummy doesn’t beat them both--because if it wins, both humans lose, equally. A perverse game of positioning!

Part of the Twisted Dummy series of two player games in the European tradition.

—description from the publisher

Name: Barby
Description:
Barby is a 2 player compendium game with a traditional deck adapted from Barbu. Barby consists of a series of hands where players choose one of seven possible games. Each game offers a task (such as avoiding the last two tricks, or trying to avoid winning Queens). After fourteen deals, each player must call each game once. The game cycles through each player's narrowing choices. Mandatory doubles keep the tension high.

—description from the designer

Name: HotRod
Description:
HotRod is a game of collecting fast cars and modifying them to race on different terrains. Players use dice to create tracks, collect HotRods or modify them. Every 5th turn, players will complete a scoring round for one of the Bonus cards. Players may want to delay a bonus card, but doing so will only offer them half of their points.

Specializing in certain Terrains or Track types can help players win big when they race each of their collected HotRods at the end of the game.

Uses language independent components!

HotRod is playable by 1-100 players (or more) in 30-60 minutes. HotRod is part of Roll and Write Revolution! Digital release initially, digital and physical copies will be available from the Game Crafter after the campaign ends.

Name: ゴープラム 踊る彫刻 (Gopuram Dancing Sculpture)
Description:
ã‚´ãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒ  è¸Šã‚‹å½«åˆ» (Gopuram Dancing Sculpture) is a game from Japan in which players are constructing a Gopuram. This is an entrance tower at a Hindu temple in Southern India. The tower is covered in elaborate, colourful statues of dancing Hindu gods. The players are the sculptors, seeking inspiration as they construct their own Gopuram.

The game has a set of cards of dancers used to form a circle. Players move glass stones around this circle in the style of a Mancala game. As they move the stones around, they build up on an animal for each player.

When the player has got enough stones on their animal, they move them on and draw sculpture cards. These show four carved figures in different colours. Players add the cards they draw to the one card they started with at the centre of their tower. In doing so, players want to complete a tower of 4,3 and then 2 cards, but with sets of coloured statues lining up in groups.

When a player completes a tower, they take a bonus card of Vishnu to top out their tower. The other players get a chance to finish their towers, and scores are calculated from groups of figures and bonus points.

The most points wins the game for the best sculpture.
user summary

Name: Town Hall: A Card Game
Description:
The game starts with players designing the Town by choosing from the 12 available districts, ranging from forest to the central business district. Changing the set up of the Town means that the game has more variability over time as districts advantage different candidates. Players are also assigned purple 'values' cards, which they share with the players next to them. This means you have things in common but, in a 4 player game, have nothing in common with the person sitting across from you! Values are important: your candidates perform better if they have the same values and your projects give you more legacy points if they also align with your values.

Once the Town is established and the districts chosen, players select cards (their candidates and inventory) and begin building up their arsenal for the upcoming elections. Be sure to select good candidates! They come with one or more Persuasive (P), Strategic (S) or Ruthless (R) skills which determines the number and type of actions they can make as candidates and later on as councillors.

Each district is up for election and players spend resources trying to ensure their candidate comes out as the winner. Players adopt the persona of their candidate and give a short 'campaign speech' to the table, outlining why they deserve your vote. The player with the "best speech" wins additional support which increases their odds of being elected. Support is also increased by the candidate's popularity in that district and any other cards you burn to give you a competitive edge. Be careful: the more you burn now, the less you can do once you're in Town Hall! Each candidate elected is worth legacy points, which decide the game.

Winning candidates become councillors who can complete project in their term of office if they have the necessary skills (P, S or R). Complete a project and get more legacy points. Diversity is key: players are rewarded bonus points for a complete PSR set of 3. At the end of 3 rounds the player with the highest number of legacy points is the winner! For experienced players, there is the option to include an add-on mode where the Mayor of the day tries to persuade players to support their proposal.

-description from publisher

Name: Boom Again
Description:
A pop culture trivia game that takes players on a nostalgic road trip through the memories from the Baby Boom era: from poodle skirts to mini skirts; The Twist to Disco; I Love Lucy to SNL; and hopscotch to protest marches.

How to Play Boom Again
  Divide the players into two teams.
  Put one token on each center section of the game board.
  Pick a category – any category.
  Someone from the other team will read you a question.
  If you get it right, “tug” the token for that category one step closer to your team’s side of the board.
  If the other team chooses the same category, they can “tug” that same token back one space toward their side.
  Play tug-of-war trying to pull tokens off the board.
  The first team to collect three tokens WINS!

Game Contents
  Two card boxes filled with 2,244 questions
  6 Boomer tokens:
    Metal Skate Key
    “Students For Kennedy” Button
    45-RPM Record Insert
    Vietnam Era Dog Tag
    Roach Clip
    Milk Bottle Cap

Name: 探偵稼業 (Detective Life)
Description:
Detective Life is a card game of information exchange and memory.
Each player, as a detective, try to collect information about six different target. In his/her turn, player exchange cards to collect information. Instead of exchanging information, player can take report action. In the action, the player declares who holds target card in his/her hand. One player can take report action up to three times throughout the game so it is  important to exchange information efficiently and to take report action at the right time.

Name: Turn Over
Description:
In football, champions make the difference!
The club has decided that this will be the turning point, new faces are needed on the pitch and on the bench! The President has left you a nice budget and carte blanche to buy the strongest players, with the certainty that you will do everything to win the Championship (and why not, even the coveted Cup of the Gods).
Turn Over is a solitaire dice and cards game, with a two player variant. Each turn you’ll roll your dice and assign them on the players cards you play to try to score more goals and concede fewer. 
Try to make a career in this managerial soccer game.

—description from the designer

Name: Meine Tierarztpraxis
Description:
We are in a veterinary practice. The players are supposed to collect 6 different animal cards by playing the matching treatment cards. On their turn, players may place up to 2 matching treatment cards from their hand on an animal. Once the treatment is completed (between 2 and 4 treatment cards are needed), you get the animal card. If no player succeeds in collecting all 6 different animals, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Jeder gegen jeden
Description:
The players, each of whom is assigned a color, receive 3 chips at the start of the game and must answer questions during the course of the game. To do this, the active player moves a figure across color fields by rolling the dice. The player whose color was hit must answer the question correctly or he loses a chip. The player who has no more chips is eliminated. If you can answer a question correctly and you have less than 3 chips, you get one chip back. The last player left wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Domino-Click
Description:
Principle like Dominoes. About half of the one- or two-color clickets are distributed equally to the players, the rest goes into a pot. the youngest player starts and puts a clicket on the table. Similar to dominoes, the next player must try to connect with a clicket of the same color. If he does not have the same color or if the clickets repel each other (because a magnetic south pole has hit a magnetic south pole or vice versa), the player must take an extra clicket from the pot and it is the next player's turn. The first player to run out of crickets to put on wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Buru: Kuda promo
Description:
The Kuda promo contains:
- 1 Kuda marker
- 1 fish token
- 1 action card
- 2 rule cards

The Kuda promo is available at the Kickstarter and the German Spieleschmiede crowdfunding pledge.

Name: Huskespil
Description:
Memory Game.  The equipment consists of: a circular wooden board with an outer ring of 16 holes, and an inner ring of 8 holes; 24 wooden pegs, with their root painted in one of six colours; a six-sided die with each face showing one of the same six colours.
The pegs are randomly placed in the holes in the board, so that the coloured tips are invisiible, and the board randomly rotated to negate any memory of their placement.
The starting player rolls the die, and then draws a peg.  If its colour matches that shown on the die, the peg is retained, the player scores a point, and has another turn (roll, draw). This continues until the peg colour does not match the die roll, in which case the peg is replaced in the same position on the board, and play passes to the next player.  Once all pegs have been drawn from the board and matched, the player with the most points is the winner.

Name: Wanna Bet? 2
Description:
Roll the die and try to perform an active or passive challenge, according to the space on which you land. The other players bet on whether you’ll be successful or not, while you win the same amount if you manage your challenge!

Comes with a Wanna Bet ball and a handy target for performing the challenges!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeons of Kards
Description:
"Yes! Dungeons, printed on cards the size of regular playing cards!"

Each Deck is a Standalone(doesn't matter with is an expansion or not)54 Card Deck, with a Dungeons&Dragons RPG style you get into direct action: monsters, items, heroes, and dungeons can play from 1 to 4 players, SOLO, COOP, and ARENA, games from 30 to 50min.

The coolest thing is that it becomes expandable by acquiring 2 Decks. Increasing possibilities: more monsters, more items, increased dungeon, and gameplay for up to 8 players.

Each Deck contains 54 cards
separated by color on the back, containing:*
Dungeon
Heroes
monsters
Accessories -Pet
Action/Attribute Cards
Gold bags

The game can be played by up to 4 Players per Deck. It is modular and infinity, so With more Decks, More Players, and big the map gets, and items are scarce in each deck making the adventure much more difficult, more decks, more items. (See the example on the photo with 4 Decks Integrate)

To win depends a lot on how you play.

ARENA:

The game becomes an arena, but to start the confrontations you need to walk through the dungeon, which contains items and monsters that can give advantages and disadvantages throughout the game. You win the match: beating the Boss (Boss) or eliminating all opponents in direct confrontation.

Coop (All against the game):

In this mode, you can help your friends to defeat all the monsters in the game and the mighty Bosso (Boss)

Solo mode:

As the title says, single player, you face all the difficulties of the game alone* (you can add the hero cards that are left in the items and during the game so you can find companions to join the adventure and help you in the battle against the incredible monsters that appear in front of you). You win the match by eliminating the Boss (Boss)

The game is a modular game, with you adding more decks, the bigger the adventure gets, with another theme the map gets huge and the difficult gets hard!

Name: Colorful Skies: Volume 2 – WWI Air War Scenarios for Check Your 6!
Description:
This is a third-party supplement that provides additional World War I scenarios for Check Your 6!.  This 48-page book covers 46 historical scenarios, all from 1918, including major engagements of the American Aero Squadron (many with Eddie Rickenbacker) and the last battles of many leading aces.

Note: The original Check Your 6! rulebook and Colorful Skies (Volume 1) are required to use this supplement.

Name: Colorful Skies: Volume 3 – WWI Air War Scenarios for Check Your 6!
Description:
This is a third-party supplement that provides additional World War I scenarios for Check Your 6!.  This 78-page book covers 61 historical scenarios, focusing on actions in (northern) Italy with Italian and British forces vs Central Powers from 1916-1918.  New balloon busting rules are also included.

Note: The original Check Your 6! rulebook and Colorful Skies (Volume 1) are required to use this supplement.

Name: What's in the Bank?
Description: A quick, quirky, and strategic card game good for 2-6 players. The basic goal of the game is to get the most points (or "Francs") in your bank by the time any player gets five cards in their bank. Most cards have point values on them, from 2-10 and then 13. Each turn, a player either puts a franc in their bank, takes a card from the draw pile, or takes a card from another player's hand. There are also special cards called Sanks, Yanks, and Thanks, which either take Francs from someone else's bank, or protects Francs in your own bank.

Name: For the Love of Honey
Description:
For The Love Of Honey is a game created just for couples!

This game gives you the chance to turn off the TV, hide your phones, and just have FUN together.

There are 2 stacks of cards with 4 categories so you can play this game over and over!

The categories are:

     Who Knows Who Better
     Trivia
     Compete
     Don't Be Scared


If you know a couple that loves games, works too hard and could use some quality 1 on 1 time, or just loves having fun, this is perfect for them!

—description from the publisher

Name: Get Out of Bed
Description:
This super fun card game tests how well you know your partner, with a twist!

If you like getting competitive and could use a fun way to sneak in a little workout together, this is the perfect game for you!

There are 2 deck of card with a mixture of 'Two Truths and a Lie' cards and 'Would You Rather' cards. Guess what your partner will say and if you're wrong, you have to do the penalty on the card!

Laugh, have fun, and learn something new about one another!

—description from from the publisher

Name: コントラスト (Contrast)
Description:
Contrast is a two-player abstract board game in the same vein as Shogi, Chess, and Checkers; with the simple goal of reaching the other side of the player board.
The transparent pieces with black and white arrows change in appearance and effect based on the background under them (a black background will hide the black arrows, a white background will hide the white arrows, and a grey background will show both).

A mysterious gimmick with simple rules, but deeper strategy than meets the eye.

Name: Ordered Witch
Description:
Ordered Witch is a fast board game for families for children that are around 4 years old.

We are little witches who need to sort the magic items that have escaped from their cupboards.

Will you be the first witch to climb to the top of the tower?

On our turn we can play a family (by item or by color) or we can play a wand to other player (wands have negative effects).

When we complete a family we gain 1 point and when we have no cards in hands we gain as points as families are in the table.

The objective is to climb to the top of the tower (15 points).

-description from publisher
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Santiago de Compostela
Description:
Waking up one day, you are filled with the overflowing passion to be as the travelers of ancient biblical times, and decide to travel to the holy land of Spain, the city of Santiago de Compostela. You thus begin your travels from your hometown of Paris to Santiago and finally return home the way whence you came.

The game is begun by shuffling the number cards (the companion cards) and laying them out between Paris and Santiago. When your turn comes, advance your pilgrim card as much as you like and earn a travel companion card. There is no restriction on the distance you can travel towards the card you desire, but there is no turning back once you advance your pilgrim.

How do you turn your journey into the best pilgrimage? By collecting travel companions (number cards)! You must choose number cards very carefully. In order to score the most by the cards you collect, you must collect as many of the same cards as possible, or collect various kind of cards. For example, the number 1 card allows you to score with just one card, but you must collect a large amount of number 9 cards (and/or a variety of cards) in order to score with them!  In this game, you win by scoring more points than other pilgrims in a total of two rounds: a journey from Paris to Santiago and another one from Santiago to Paris.

“Maybe the real treasure was the friends we made along the way”.

Name: The Hunger: Vampire Promo Sheets
Description: A set of the 6 character sheets which give each playable vampire a one time per game ability. These were handed out at conventions or as a bonus for pre-ordering the base game through Renegade Games website.

Name: Necromunda: Book of the Outcast
Description:
Expand your games of Necromunda with a wealth of new rules to add even more variety, scope, and excitement to your battles in the underhive. With this book you can explore the dark expanse of the hive city's badzones, striking out to found settlements and expand your territory in Outlands campaigns, as well as enlisting the aid of brand new Dramatis Personae to join or even lead your Underhive Outcasts gang.

Inside this 136-page book you'll find:

– Outcasts of Necromunda: Extensive background information on outcasts gangs, covering aspects such as the badzones, the scum that comprise an Underhive Outcasts gang, and why such maligned members of the underhive would be inclined to sign up

– Assembling the Outcasts: Includes all the rules you need to know in order to field an outcasts gang in skirmish and narrative games of Necromunda, including gang composition, weapons and wargear, and additional rules for creating your own charismatic Leader with a personality all their own

– Hangers-On and Brutes: Includes rules for hiring Hangers-on and Brutes, for both skirmish and narratives games

– Outlander Terrain: All the terrain rules needed to establish a stronghold for Necromunda gangs, usable with the included Outlander Campaign or any game of Necromunda, as well as rules for fighting across Underhive Markets, Walls and Gates, Watchtowers, and Gunk Tanks

– Wyrd Powers: Light up the underhive with rules for Wyrd Powers and Force Weapons that canand Telekinesis

– Outlander Campaigns: Embark on a narrative campaign to build and grow a settlement while defending and denying resources from your rivals, and assume the role of an Arbitrator keeping the campaign on an even keel while players work through three real-time phases training recruits, gathering resources, and recovering from the wear and tear of underhive combat

– Outlander Scenarios: Rules for six new outcasts-themed scenarios – Settlement Raid, Market Mayhem, Stealth Attack, Gunk Tank, Mining Expedition and The Big Score – each including rules for playing the battle, rewards gained for victory, experience, reputation, and special rules for these scenarios

– Showcase: A full-colour section spotlighting miniatures, battle scenes, and alternative outcasts colour schemes

– Outcasts Gang Tactics: Eighteen new Gang Tactics for use in games, plus rules and background for Lady Credo, Rebel Lord – a unique Rebel Lord who can be chosen as an Underhive Outcasts Leader at gang creation

– Trading Post: Weapons, armour, and equipment available to Underhive Outcasts gangs, who must rely on whatever they can find and barter for without the backing of the major Houses

– A Weapon Reference Chart containing a comprehensive weapons reference chart for all weapons and wargear available on the Trading Post for outcasts gangs

– Dramatis Personae: Includes rules for hiring and using three brand-new Dramatis Personae in your games of Necromunda

This is an expansion to Necromunda – you'll need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook to use the contents of this book.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Fort Sumter: Solo Opponent
Description: GMT One’s free Christmas print and play for 2021. With this Solo Opponent, Fort Sumter can be played by a single Player with the game controlling the side not controlled by the Player. Using the same system as Red Flag Over Paris, the Fort Sumter Solo Opponent is a tough challenge for one.

Name: Twisted History
Description: A historical trivia game that sees you moving through different time periods and answering questions about that time. For every answer you get wrong, you build part of your own execution device. Get 9 incorrect answers and you are out of the game.

Name: Yeti Slap
Description: Yeti Slap is a speed card game where players try to get rid of their cards the fastest. Player's slap down cards on top of matches, but if an action comes up, players must be the fastest to do the action and then can slap down another card on the action card. Learn in 5 minutes, play for years!

Name: Jungleball
Description:
Jungleball is a small box dexterity game where you can draft a team of all-stars discovering powerful synergies between the large roster of unique players! You can assemble your players around an arena that changes with every game, toss dodgeballs at your opponents, move around the field, activate abilities, AND land critical hits until only one team remains!

Do you have what it takes to be a Jungleball champion?

Jungleball is a dexterity game that plays in about 15 minutes. The game is played through a sequence of turns where players will throw small wooden disks at their opponent's characters hoping to land on them and get them out. Every character has a number indicating the amount of dodgeballs that can land on them before they must go out. Activating a character allows the player to move that character anywhere on the board, use that character's unique ability, and then throw dodgeballs (wooden disks) from wherever they move that character to. Play ends if all the characters on one team go out, the player with characters remaining is the victor!

-description from publisher

Name: Horseshoes & Hand Grenades Card Game
Description:
An explosive card game unlike any other for friend and foe alike. Rule game night by obliterating the competition with unique card types. Set the charges or pull the pin early and let the sparks fly because only one player can call themselves the victor in this all out brawl of Horseshoes & Hand Grenades!

- Obliterate the competition with Hand Grenade cards. 
- Shield yourself from the opposition with Horseshoe cards. 
- Defy the actions of others with Short Fuse cards.

Play as a team or fight alone, the choice is yours. All that matters is that you are the last one standing.

Begin by choosing who goes first, preferably the least liked of your friends, who smells the worst, has the loudest burp or is the mostly to die first (in the game, don't be so morbid). The chosen player with then shuffle the deck and deal every player 5 cards and 5 Heart Tokens. The player to the left of the dealer will then begin the game with the first play action as the Active Player.

Once a player loses all 5 Heart Tokens, they are out. So, make sure to maintain your defenses since any defenses that are down, leave your Heart Tokens completely exposed.

On the Active Players turn, they can play 1 Hand Grenade card to attack with and 1 Horseshoe card to build up their defenses. No more than 3 Horseshoe cards can be in play for each player. After they have completed their two actions, they must draw a card to end their turn so that the Active Player status transfers to the next player on the left.

On the Inactive Players turn, they can play Short Fuse cards in response to any action performed by the Active Player or other Inactive Players, shifting the tides to favor themselves or others. But, they must be careful, since the Active Player can play Short Fuses in response to others.

In the end, only one shall remain. You may refer to yourself as the victor, but everyone else may refer to you as a frag-faced-fuck. So, pull the pin, count to 3 and have some explosive fun with Horseshoes & Hand Grenades.

Name: Aventuria: Bornländische Katzenhexe Heldenset
Description:
Dieses Heldenset enthält das Heldendeck der Bornländischen Katzenhexe Rovena aus dem Überwals. Außerdem sind die Kurzabenteuer Hexenreigen und Ein Goblin mehr oder weniger und alle dafür erforderlichen Spielkarten enthalten. 
—description from the publisher

This hero set contains the hero deck of the Bornland cat witch Rovena. In addition two short adventures 'Hexenreigen' and 'Ein Goblin mehr oder weniger' and all necessary playing cards are included.
—user translation

This hero was previously part of the discontinued expansion Aventuria: Heroes' Struggle. This is due to the reorientation of the game with its new expansions of the last (german) crowdfunding Aventuria: Mythische Geschichten and Pfad der Legenden. With these the game focuses a lot more on narrative and therefore less on the old short story adventures of Heroes' Struggle.

Name: Shaktis
Description:
Game Type: Strategic Board Game
Players: 2
Playtime: 60-90 minutes
Theme: Strategy, Philosophy, Nature
Objective: Cultivate thematic gardens with strategic Seedstone placement, utilising Yaksis' abilities and the Botanical Codex.

'Shaktis: Mind the Plot' is a unique board game that blends strategy, nature, and philosophy within a mystical forest setting. Players embark on a journey to create thematic gardens by strategically placing Seedstones, leveraging the abilities of guardian Yaksis. This game emphasizes a balance between chance and choice, encouraging players to engage in philosophical debates and explore botanical wonders. With its innovative "Ripple Rule," the game ensures every decision impacts the evolving narrative, offering a rich, thematic experience that challenges the mind and soul.

—description from the designer

Name: Thorngate Dungeon
Description:
A Single Sheet Print and Play Eurogame. Simple to pick up play with plenty of strategy, depth and decision space.

Thorngate Tower has been taken over by all manner of unworldy creatures. Your task is to initially clear out the dungeon area. Whilst slaying foes from 4 different realms to gain the favour of Thorngates guild owners you must also try to rescue as much treasure as you can along the way in order to prove that you are worthy of entering the remainder of the Tower.

Thorngate Dungeon is played over a series of 16 Rounds where in each you will be taking actions based on the rolls of 4 dice. Everything is contained on a single sheet of A4 paper and all that is needed from you is a pencil per player and 4 dice for the whole group.

—description from the designer

Name: Dice & Towers
Description:
Dice & Towers is a push-your-luck polyhedral dice game for 1-6 players.


     Roll the special "Die Die" to determine which dice to stack next (example: rolling a 12 means stack the D12). 
     Stack dice to build a tower as high as you choose - but don't let it fall! 
     Roll the dice from your tower to earn points. 
     Win by earning the most combined points in three turns.


—description from the publisher

Name: Cowpie Catapults
Description:
It’s Cow Pie Catapults – the poo flippin’, cow tippin’ battle of the barnyard! Arrange your cows on your side of the barnyard, load up the catapults, and let the fun begin! On 3-2-1 poo is launched through the air and lands with splendid splats. First player to knock over all the opponent’s cows is the winner!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Food Who?
Description:
This is a game for 2 players with each their own game board filled with 24 types of food. The opponent has to guess the food to win.

The game dynamics are similar to Guess Who?, the mystery face game where you flip over a collection of faces with different color hair, eye color, hair, hats, glasses etc. to deduce who the secret person is that your opponent has chosen. In Food Who? you flip over the hooked tiles with pizza, pies, meats, snacks, vegetables, etc. as you narrow your choices by asking characteristic questions.

Name: MicroMacro: Crime City – Full House: Die Schwarze Witwe
Description: An exclusive bonus case for MicroMacro: Crime City - Full House.

Name: QUIZscape: Probe-Spiel
Description:
A demo case for the QUIZscape series, published by moses Verlag. This demo contains a very small time travel story that demonstrates the mechanisms of the QUIZscape games. The players have to travel through time to rescue a missing team.

Each card contains a riddle that has to be solved to continue in the story.

Name: Cartographers: Map Pack 4 – Frozen Expanse: Realm of Frost Giants
Description:
Chill winds howl across the Frozen Expanse, where the Kaiika make their home and fearsome Frost Giants lumber through the snow. Queen Gimnax sent you to this cursed place with the fruits of a past expedition: the torn scraps of a map, partially finished by another cartographer who did not survive the journey.   Now it’s up to you to finish mapping the Frozen Expanse with the work of an  ill-fated guildfellow to guide your way.

Cartographers: Map Pack 4, Frozen Expanse can be played with either Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale or Cartographers Heroes.

It includes 75 double-sided new map sheets featuring above pre-scouted spaces and a frozen lake, two new ambush cards, and one new hero card. Players must plan carefully while adhering to new terrain placement requirements and can earn a large bonus for surrounding a lake.

Name: Corrida de Canetas
Description:
Experience the thrill of hectic and challenging races without needing much.

Pen Races is a dexterity racing game in which players race each other to see who completes the circuits before the others. You score points by finishing before the opponents but for every fault you lose points. Some challenges are put into play and if you complete them during your run, you add some points to your ranking.

After 3 races, whoever has conquered the most points win.
The game can be expandable for more players if you put two boxes together.

Who better to combine speed and precision wins the match.

-description from designer

Name: Cartographers: Map Pack 5 – Kethra's Steppe: Redtooth & Goldbelly
Description:
From the grassy plain of Kethra’s Steppe rise the twin spires of Redtooth Peak and Goldbelly Mountain. In addition to charting the terrain around these mountains, you must rekindle the mysterious beacons atop their summits. These fires once burned every night to represent the eye of Kethra, goddess of thresholds and gates. Queen Gimnax hopes that renewing their flames will gain her the goddess’s favor, perhaps opening the door to other worlds.

Cartographers: Map Pack 5, Kethra’s Steppe can be played with either Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale or Cartographers Heroes.

It includes 75 double-sided new map sheets featuring twin mountain spires and their beacon ranges and 3 new scoring cards, specifically for use with this map pack. Players light beacons by surrounding them and score points based on a 5th type of scoring card introduced in this map pack.

Name: Cartographers: Map Pack 6 – Hornhelm: Wasteland Market
Description:
Deep in the barren wastes lies the famed Saurian market at Hornhelm, where merchants from across Ulos gather to hawk their wares. On display are fine fabrics, aromatic spices, and a variety of impressively crafted goods. Of particular interest to you are the merchants selling specialized gear that can increase the speed of your labour and the accuracy of your maps. Improve your tradecraft by equipping yourself with items from the wasteland market.

Cartographers: Map Pack 6, Hornhelm can be played with either Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale or Cartographers Heroes.

It includes 150 double-sided new map sheets featuring a market to purchase items and 6 merchant cards, a new card type specifically for use with this map pack. Players receive two sheets - one on the map side (front) and one on the market side (back) - and purchase items for ongoing effects and reputation stars at the end of the game.

Name: Hello Kitty & Amigos: Um dia para Relaxar
Description:
Hello Kitty and her friends have a nice day ahead and must decide what to do. But every one has his preferences (randomly distributed in the beginning of the game). Where they go?

There are 16 different activities and the player use a dice to manipulate the position of every activity in a "Preference Scale".

Each time an activity reach the spot 8 in the preference scale, the players stop the game to make a decision: Are we according to go to this activity? In order to do so, every player has a hand of five cards (4 "No" cards and 1 "Yes" card). If any player use a No Card, the activity is discarded. Yes Cards return to the players, but "No" cards are also discarded, so the players will have less opportunities to use "No" cards during the game.

If an activity receives only yes cards, the game ends and the players receive victory points according the position of his/her preference activity in the preference scale. Discarded activities bring no victory points.

Name: Gathering of the Wicked: Cruella De Vil & Jasper and Horace
Description:
A new villain team to add to the game:

Cruella de Vil:

Before each group vote, insist that a certain player votes against another player of your choice. If they refuse, they are automatically vanquished.

Jasper and Hoarace:

Jasper and Hoarace do not have a special ability. Disney Henchmen who vote against their Disney Villain couterpart run serious risks. If they choose to vote against their Disney Villain, and if the Disney Villain is vanquished and found to be a member of Team Mayhem, then the Disney Henchman is immediately vanquished too!

Promo pack was available for free with purchase of the game during launch.

Name: Hexa Ruins
Description:
ãƒ˜ã‚¯ã‚µãƒ»ãƒ«ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ (Hexa Ruins) is a roll & write game from Japan. Players are exploring a jungle land for treasures and ruins. Key to the game is the date and time you play. At the start of the game, write these down on your sheet, and the numbers create your starting equipment and coins.

As the game progresses, you roll a red and a blue die and make your moves across the hex map of the landscape. The die rolls apply to your equipment and coins, and you choose how you move. The map shows water, plains, mountains and treasure sites. In the top corner is the fabled Hexa Ruins. The game ends when a player reaches here, or after 30 turns.

Players calculate their scores based on their exploration and the most points wins.

The publisher has already released new maps for PnP purchase online.
user summary

Name: What's the Story? Story Telling Cards
Description:
What’s the Story? invites children to retell and create stories with playful animal characters and adventures. There are endless ways to use these cards. The publishers include many suggestions and you can develop your own.

The game includes many rule variants, with differing win conditions including some requiring a certain number of cards to win.


        description from publisher **

Name: BABEL: 0
Description:
An expansion set that adds a new way to play "BABEL".

Each player bids off the right to build the Tower of Babel and raises the tower while earning points. At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins. The winning bidder does not necessarily build the tower. The tower will be built by the person with the highest total score at the time of winning the auction. If they fail to build it, they will lose immediately. The player with the second highest score at that time will be the winner.
